member.summary: Gets a string containing the name of the Node. The structure of the name will differ with the name type.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.ChildNodes
member.summary: Gets a live NodeList containing all the children of this node. Being live means that if the children of the node change, the NodeList object is automatically updated.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones the node, and optionally, all of its contents. By default, it clones the content of the node.
member.param: Optionally: Sets if all of the content should be cloned as well.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.summary: Determines if two nodes are equal.
member.param: The node to be compared to the node that is executing the method.
member.returns: True if the node specified in the otherNode parameter is equal to the current node.

member.summary: Compares the position of two nodes in a document.
member.param: The node to be compared to the reference node, which is the node executing the method.
member.returns: The relation between the two nodes.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.Normalize
member.summary: Cleans up all the text nodes under this element, i.e. merges adjacent and removes empty text nodes.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.Owner
member.summary: Gets the Document that this node belongs to. If no document is associated with it, returns null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.ParentElement
member.summary: Gets an Element that is the parent of this node. If the node has no parent, or if that parent is not an Element, this property returns null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.Parent
member.summary: Gets a node that is the parent of this node. If there is no such node, like if this node is the top of the tree or if doesn't participate in a tree, this property returns null.

member.summary: Returns true if other is an inclusive descendant of the context object, and false otherwise (including when other is null).
member.param: The Node to check the childs for.
member.returns: True if the given node is contained within this Node, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.FirstChild

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.LastChild

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets a Node representing the next node in the tree, or null if there isn't such node.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets a Node representing the previous node in the tree, or null if there isn't such node.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.LookupPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the namespace prefix associated with a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), if any.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker
member.summary: The TreeWalker object represents the nodes of a document subtree and a position within them.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Root
member.summary: Gets a Node representing the root node as specified when the TreeWalker was created.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Current
member.summary: Gets or sets the Node on which the TreeWalker is currently pointing at.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Settings
member.summary: Gets a description of the types of nodes that must to be presented. Non-matching nodes are skipped, but their children may be included, if relevant.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Filter
member.summary: Gets the NodeFilter used to select the relevant nodes.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToNext
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the next visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.
member.returns: The next Node, if any.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToPrevious
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the previous visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists,or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.
member.returns: The previous Node, if any.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToParent
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the first visible ancestor node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToFirst
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the first visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToLast
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the last visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToPreviousSibling
member.summary: Moves the current Node to its previous sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. I there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToNextSibling
member.summary: Moves the current Node to its next sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. I there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

member.summary: Checks if the document has any active stylesheets that block the scripts. A style sheet is blocking scripts if the responsible element was created by that Document's parser, and the element is either a style element or a link element that was an external resource link that contributes to the styling processing model when the element was created by the parser, and the element's style sheet was enabled when the element was created by the parser, and the element's style sheet ready flag is not yet set. http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/document-metadata.html#has-no-style-sheet-that-is-blocking-scripts
member.returns: Enumerable of awaitable tasks.

member.returns: Awaitable task.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.StringExtensions.UrlEncode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Replaces characters in names and values that should not be in URL values. Replaces the bytes 0x20 (U+0020 SPACE if interpreted as ASCII) with a single 0x2B byte ("+" (U+002B) character if interpreted as ASCII). If a byte is not in the range 0x2A, 0x2D, 0x2E, 0x30 to 0x39, 0x41 to 0x5A, 0x5F, 0x61 to 0x7A, it is replaced with its hexadecimal value (zero-padded if necessary), starting with the percent sign.
member.returns: The encoded value.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.StringExtensions.UrlDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the provided percent encoded string. An exception is thrown in case of an invalid input value.
member.returns: The decoded content.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.StringExtensions.NormalizeLineEndings(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces every occurrence of a "CR" (U+000D) character not followed by a "LF" (U+000A) character, and every occurrence of a "LF" (U+000A) character not preceded by a "CR" (U+000D) character, by a two-character string consisting of a U+000D CARRIAGE RETURN "CRLF" (U+000A) character pair.
member.returns: The normalized string.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.WindowExtensions.ComputeCascadedStyle(AngleSharp.Dom.Collections.StyleCollection,AngleSharp.Dom.IElement)
member.summary: Computes the cascaded style, i.e. resolves the cascade by ordering after specifity. Two rules with the same specifity are ordered according to their appearance. The more recent declaration wins. Inheritance is not taken into account.
member.param: The element to compute the cascade for.
member.returns: Returns the cascaded read-only style declaration.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Pool
member.summary: Provides a pool of used / recycled resources.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Pool.NewStringBuilder
member.summary: Either creates a fresh stringbuilder or gets a (cleaned) used one.
member.returns: A stringbuilder to use.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Pool.NewSelectorConstructor(AngleSharp.Services.IAttributeSelectorFactory,AngleSharp.Services.IPseudoClassSelectorFactory,AngleSharp.Services.IPseudoElementSelectorFactory)
member.summary: Either creates a fresh selector constructor or gets a (cleaned) used one.
member.returns: A selector constructor to use.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Pool.NewValueBuilder
member.summary: Either creates a fresh value builder or gets a (cleaned) used one.
member.returns: A value builder to use.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Pool.ToPool(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns the given stringbuilder to the pool and gets the current string content.
member.returns: The string that is created in the stringbuilder.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Pool.ToPool(AngleSharp.Parser.Css.CssSelectorConstructor)
member.summary: Returns the given selector constructor to the pool and gets the constructed selector.
member.returns: The Selector that is created in the constructor.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Pool.ToPool(AngleSharp.Parser.Css.CssValueBuilder)
member.summary: Returns the given value builder to the pool and gets the constructed value.
member.returns: The value that is contained in the builder.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.CorsSetting.None
member.summary: The default (missing) value.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.CorsSetting.Anonymous
member.summary: Cross-origin CORS requests for the element will have the omit credentials flag set.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.CorsSetting.UseCredentials

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest
member.summary: Represents the arguments to load a document.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.#ctor(AngleSharp.Url)
member.summary: Creates a new document request for the given url.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Get(AngleSharp.Url,AngleSharp.Dom.INode,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a GET request for the given target from the optional source node and optional referer string.
member.param: The optional source of the request.
member.returns: The new document request.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Post(AngleSharp.Url,System.IO.Stream,System.String,AngleSharp.Dom.INode,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a POST request for the given target with the provided body and encoding type from the optional source node and optional referer string.
member.param: The type of the request's body.
The optional source of the request.
member.returns: The new document request.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.PostAsPlaintext(AngleSharp.Url,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Creates a POST request for the given target with the fields being used to generate the body and encoding type plaintext.
member.returns: The new document request.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.PostAsUrlencoded(AngleSharp.Url,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Creates a POST request for the given target with the fields being used to generate the body and encoding type url encoded.
member.returns: The new document request.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source of the request, if any.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Target
member.summary: Gets the target of the request.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Referer
member.summary: Gets or sets the referrer of the request, if any. The name is intentionally spelled wrong, to emphasize the relationship with the HTTP header.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the method to use.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream of the request's body.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.MimeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the mime-type to use, if any.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DocumentRequest.Headers
member.summary: Gets a list of headers (key-values) that should be used.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames
member.summary: The collection of (known / used) header names.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.CacheControl
member.summary: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client or vice-versa whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds. e.g. Cache-Control: no-cache e.g. Cache-Control: max-age=3600

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Connection
member.summary: Options that are desired for the connection, e.g. Connection: keep-alive e.g. Connection: close

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the request/response body in octets (8-bit bytes), e.g. Content-Length: 348

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentMd5
member.summary: A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the response, e.g. Content-MD5: Q2hlY2sgSW50ZWdyaXR5IQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentType
member.summary: The MIME type of this content (only used with POST / PUT methods), e.g. Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded e.g. Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Date
member.summary: The date and time that the message was sent, e.g. Date: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 08:12:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Pragma
member.summary: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain, e.g. Pragma: no-cache

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Via
member.summary: Informs the client or server of proxies through which the response or request was sent, e.g. Via: 1.0 fred, 1.1 example.com (Apache/1.1)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Warning
member.summary: A general warning about possible problems with the entity body, e.g. Warning: 199 Miscellaneous warning

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Accept
member.summary: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response, e.g. Accept: text/plain

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptCharset
member.summary: Character sets that are acceptable, e.g. Accept-Charset: utf-8

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: List of acceptable encodings. See HTTP compression, e.g. Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: List of acceptable human languages for response, e.g. Accept-Language: en-US

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptDatetime
member.summary: Acceptable version in time, e.g. Accept-Datetime: Thu, 31 May 2007 20:35:00 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Authorization
member.summary: Authentication credentials for HTTP authentication, e.g. Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Cookie
member.summary: An HTTP cookie previously sent by the server with Set-Cookie, e.g. Cookie: $Version=1; Skin=new;

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Expect
member.summary: Indicates that particular server behaviors are required by the client, e.g. Expect: 100-continue

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.From
member.summary: The email address of the user making the request, e.g. From: user@example.com

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Host
member.summary: The domain name of the server (for virtual hosting), and the TCP port number on which the server is listening. The port number may be omitted if the port is the standard port for the service requested. Mandatory since HTTP/1.1. Although domain name are specified as case-insensitive, it is not specified whether the contents of the Host field should be interpreted in a case-insensitive manner and in practice some implementations of virtual hosting interpret the contents of the Host field in a case-sensitive manner, e.g. Host: en.wikipedia.org:80

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfMatch
member.summary: Only perform the action if the client supplied entity matches the same entity on the server. This is mainly for methods like PUT to only update a resource if it has not been modified since the user last updated it, e.g. If-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfModifiedSince
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, e.g. If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfNoneMatch
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, e.g. If-None-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfRange
F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: Only send the response if the entity has not been modified since a specific time, e.g. If-Unmodified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.MaxForwards
member.summary: Limit the number of times the message can be forwarded through proxies or gateways, e.g. Max-Forwards: 10

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Origin
F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ProxyAuthorization
member.summary: Authorization credentials for connecting to a proxy, e.g. Proxy-Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Range
member.summary: Request only part of an entity. Bytes are numbered from 0, e.g. Range: bytes=500-999

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Referer
member.summary: This is the address of the previous web page from which a link to the currently requested page was followed. (The word referrer is misspelled in the RFC as well as in most implementations.), e.g. Referer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Te
member.summary: The transfer encodings the user agent is willing to accept: the same values as for the response header Transfer-Encoding can be used, plus the "trailers" value (related to the "chunked" transfer method) to notify the server it expects to receive additional headers (the trailers) after the last, zero-sized, chunk, e.g. TE: trailers, deflate

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Upgrade
member.summary: Ask the server to upgrade to another protocol, e.g. Upgrade: HTTP/2.0, SHTTP/1.3, IRC/6.9, RTA/x11

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent string of the user agent, e.g. User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/21.0

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AccessControlAllowOrigin
member.summary: Specifying which web sites can participate in cross-origin resource sharing, e.g. Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptRanges
member.summary: What partial content range types this server supports, e.g. Accept-Ranges: bytes

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Age
member.summary: The age the object has been in a proxy cache in seconds, e.g. Age: 12

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Allow
member.summary: Valid actions for a specified resource. To be used for a 405 Method not allowed, e.g. Allow: GET, HEAD

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The type of encoding used on the data, e.g. Content-Encoding: gzip

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentLanguage
member.summary: The language the content is in, e.g. Content-Language: da

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentLocation
member.summary: An alternate location for the returned data, e.g. Content-Location: /index.htm

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentDisposition
member.summary: An opportunity to raise a "File Download" dialog box for a known MIME type with binary format or suggest a filename for dynamic content. Quotes are necessary with special characters, e.g. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="fname.ext"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentRange
member.summary: Where in a full body message this partial message belongs, e.g. Content-Range: bytes 21010-47021/47022

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ETag
member.summary: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest, e.g. ETag: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Expires
member.summary: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale, e.g. Expires: Thu, 01 Dec 1994 16:00:00 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.LastModified
member.summary: The last modified date for the requested object, in RFC2822 format, e.g. Last-Modified: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 12:45:26 +0000

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Link
member.summary: Used to express a typed relationship with another resource, where the relation type is defined by RFC5988, e.g. Link: </feed>; rel="alternate"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Location
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created, e.g. Location: http://www.w3.org/pub/WWW/People.html

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.P3p
member.summary: This header is supposed to set P3P policy, in the form of P3P:CP="your_compact_policy". However, P3P did not take off, most browsers have never fully implemented it, a lot of websites set this header with fake policy text, that was enough to fool browsers the existence of P3P policy and grant permissions for third party cookies, e.g. P3P: CP="This is not a P3P policy! See ... for more info."

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ProxyAuthenticate
member.summary: Request authentication to access the proxy, e.g. Proxy-Authenticate: Basic

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Refresh
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created. This refresh redirects after 5 seconds, e.g. Refresh: 5; url=http://www.w3.org/pub/WWW/People.html

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.RetryAfter
member.summary: If an entity is temporarily unavailable, this instructs the client to try again after a specified period of time (in seconds), e.g. Retry-After: 120

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Server
member.summary: A name for the server, e.g. Server: Apache/2.4.1 (Unix)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.SetCookie
member.summary: An HTTP cookie, e.g. Set-Cookie: UserID=JohnDoe; Max-Age=3600; Version=1

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Status
member.summary: The HTTP status of the response. "Status" is not listed as a registered header. The "Status-Line" of a "Response" is defined by RFC2616 without any explicit Status: header name, e.g. Status: 200 OK

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.StrictTransportSecurity
member.summary: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains, e.g. Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=16070400; includeSubDomains

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Trailer
member.summary: The Trailer general field value indicates that the given set of header fields is present in the trailer of a message encoded with chunked transfer-coding, e.g. Trailer: Max-Forwards

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.TransferEncoding
member.summary: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity, e.g. Transfer-Encoding: chunked

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Vary
member.summary: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server, e.g. Vary: *

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.WwwAuthenticate
member.summary: Indicates the authentication scheme that should be used to access the requested entity, e.g. WWW-Authenticate: Basic
